title: Bringing Used-Car Communities into Cardano Governance
summary: Cardano governance in Indonesia lacks real-world voices from used-car buyers, dealers, and mechanics; there is no clear bridge that turns these communities into voters, reviewers, and ambassadors.
solution: Training used-car community members in Central Java to become Cardano governance ambassadors, linking CAR-dano operations, local auto groups, and Catalyst into one continuous feedback loop.
proposer_name: PT Inspeksi Mobil Jogja (PALAPA Inspeksi)/ CAR-dano v1
proposer_relevant_experience:

sub_fields.title: Describe any dependencies or write 'No dependencies'
sub_fields.description: Here you should list any dependencies and prerequisites for your project's success. These are usually external factors (such as third-party suppliers, external resources, third-party software, etc.) that may cause a delay, since a project has less control over them. In case of third party software, indicate whether you have the necessary licenses and permission to use such software.
sub_fields.answer: Dependencies on other organizations or technical infrastructure This project depends lightly, and non-critically, on: Existing Cardano infrastructure (wallets and governance-capable wallets, governance portals, block explorers, standard NFT/metadata formats). Catalyst governance infrastructure (voter registration flows, voting portals, community tools). Basic off-chain services from PT Inspeksi Mobil Jogja (PALAPA) to provide non-sensitive examples (anonymised reports, sample PDFs, simple CSV/JSON exports). None of these are single points of failure. If a wallet, portal, or tool changes, we can adjust training materials and examples. There is no dependency on a proprietary vendor token, closed-source SDK, or locked ecosystem.

sub_fields.title: Who you’re targeting, how you’ll reach them, and why this matters for Cardano?
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
# **Primary targets**


**Used\-car ecosystem in Central Java**

- Buyers and sellers of used cars (B2C and C2C).
- Independent and small used-car dealers.
- Workshop owners, mechanics, and inspection technicians around Surakarta and Yogyakarta.



**Local community leaders in automotive circles**

- Admins of car clubs (model-based clubs, regional communities).
- Influential used-car content creators (YouTube, Instagram, TikTok).
- People who already act as informal advisors in car purchase decisions.



**Early Cardano\-curious / crypto\-aware individuals inside those communities**

- People who have used exchanges or wallets but never engaged in governance.
- Community members with leadership potential who could become long-term ambassadors if given clear structure and support.

# How we will reach them


**Embedded community activities**



We will run small, focused gatherings hosted at:

1. Used-car showrooms,
2. Workshops / garages,
3. Neutral community spaces in Surakarta and Yogyakarta.

Sessions will be framed first around car-buying safety and transparency (pain points they already know), and only then introduce Cardano and Catalyst as governance and trust tools not as “coin trading”.



**Ambassador recruitment campaigns**



We will recruit via:

1. Existing PALAPA customer and partner networks,
2. Local car clubs and WhatsApp / Telegram groups,
3. Automotive-focused social media in Central Java.

The value proposition is simple: ambassadors gain knowledge, status, and a visible role as the “bridge” between their community and a global blockchain governance system.



**Governance\-focused training and onboarding**



We will run hands-on workshops covering:

1. Secure wallet setup and management,
2. How to register as a Catalyst voter,
3. Understanding proposals, DReps, and treasury,
4. How to explain all of this in simple, non-technical Indonesian (with optional Javanese touches).



Printed and digital materials will be produced in Bahasa Indonesia, including scripts, checklists, and visual flows that ambassadors can reuse when teaching others.

# Why this matters for Cardano


Cardano governance needs more than English-speaking, tech-savvy users. It needs representation from people whose daily economic life will be impacted by real-world assets, warranties, data registries, and lending products being built on-chain.



The used-car sector is:

- Large and high-frequency,
- Data- and trust-intensive,
- Full of participants who understand risk, fraud, and long-term value even if they are not “Web3 natives”.



By training ambassadors from this sector, Cardano gains:

- Voters and reviewers who judge proposals through a real-world trust and consumer protection lens,
- Storytellers who can explain Cardano governance in everyday language,
- A pattern that can later be reused in other verticals (property, logistics, agriculture).



This is not just about teaching people to hold ADA. It is about building a human governance interface between Cardano and one of the most trust-challenged industries in Indonesia.

sub_fields.title: Provide a list of key activities of your project:
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
We group activities into three work-streams:



**1\. Ambassador Program Design & Recruitment**



- Define clear ambassador roles, responsibilities, expectations, and modest benefits.



- Produce an accessible Ambassador Handbook explaining:
1. What Cardano and Catalyst are in practical terms,
2. What “governance” means for used-car trust,
3. Concrete tasks ambassadors will perform each month.



- Recruit 20–30 initial ambassador candidates drawn from:
- Car clubs,
- Workshops and small dealers,
- PALAPA customers with leadership influence.



**2\. Training, Tooling & Content**



- Deliver 3–4 core training sessions (in-person or hybrid):
1. Session 1: Cardano & trust in used-car markets.
2. Session 2: Project Catalyst and governance basics (proposals, DReps, treasury).
3. Session 3: Practical voter onboarding (wallets, registration, security).
4. Session 4: How to host a community session and explain Cardano simply.



- Produce local-language content packs for ambassadors:
1. Slide decks,
2. One-page flyers,
3. Short videos / reels,
4. FAQ sheets responding to typical doubts (“Is this just trading?”, “Is this safe?”, etc.).



**3\. Community Activation & Governance Onboarding**



- Each ambassador runs micro-events in their own circles:
1. Small meetups in workshops, showrooms, parking areas, or group chats,
2. Short online sessions in WhatsApp/Telegram communities.



- Provide continuous support:
1. Co-host key events when needed,
2. Technical help during voter registration,
3. Group channels for questions and experience sharing.



- Collect data and stories:
1. Number of people trained,
2. Number of governance-capable wallets registered,
3. Qualitative feedback on what resonates and what remains confusing.



- Document the full process as a Community Ambassador Playbook for reuse.

sub_fields.title: What are your success metrics?
sub_fields.description: Please provide your rationale.
sub_fields.answer:
We consider the project successful if we reach or exceed:



**Community & governance participation**

- ≥ 25 active ambassadors trained (from at least 3 groups: car clubs, workshops, dealers/customers).
- ≥ 150 community members attending ambassador-led sessions (cumulative).
- ≥ 100 governance-capable wallets registered for a Catalyst voting round, supported with Indonesian-language guidance.



**Quality and sustainability**

- ≥ 70% of ambassadors remain active until the end of the 6-month cycle (based on attendance, event logs, and check-ins).
- ≥ 70% of surveyed participants report that:
1. “I understand the basic idea of Cardano and why governance matters.”
2. “I can see at least one way Cardano could improve trust in used-car transactions.”



**Ecosystem artifacts**

- 1 Community Ambassador Playbook (EN/ID) published under an open license.
- ≥ 6 reusable content assets (slides, videos, handouts) that other Cardano groups can adopt.
- ≥ 2 case stories showing how governance discussions changed when used-car community members were included.

sub_fields.title: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.description: Please describe your proposed solution and how it addresses the problem
sub_fields.answer:
# Overview
**Bringing Used\-Car Communities into Cardano Governance \(CAR\-dano Community Ambassador Hub – Indonesia\)** is a 6-month program to build a structured ambassador network around the used-car ecosystem in Central Java and to plug that network directly into Cardano governance.

The program connects:

1. A live used-car inspection operation (PT Inspeksi Mobil Jogja / CAR-dano v1),
2. Existing automotive communities (clubs, workshops, dealers), and
3. Cardano governance tools and processes,

into one loop: **learn → practice → onboard others → feed insights back to Catalyst\.**

Instead of trying to build a generic “Cardano Indonesia” initiative, we focus on a single, concrete vertical  used cars and inspections  where trust is a daily problem and Cardano already has a technical footprint.

# How this addresses the problem
**From “crypto insiders” to real\-world community leaders\.**

Today, governance conversations are dominated by people already comfortable with Web3. By recruiting ambassadors from car clubs, workshops, and small dealerships, we:

1. Inject practical, real-world perspectives into Cardano discussions,
2. Reach people who already influence real purchase decisions,
3. Give communities recognizable local faces representing Cardano governance.

**From abstract governance to guided local\-language practice**

Catalyst voter registration and proposal evaluation can be overwhelming. The program breaks it into:

1. Simple training sessions,
2. Clear scripts and wallet flows in Bahasa Indonesia,
3. Reusable checklists ambassadors can follow.

People don’t just “read docs”; they sit together, open their phones, register step-by-step, and connect governance to issues they care about (e.g., trustworthy car data).

**From one\-off outreach to a repeatable ambassador cycle**

Many campaigns create a spike of attention and then disappear. This program is intentionally cyclical:

**Design → recruitment → training → micro\-events → support → reflection → documented pattern\.**

Ambassadors are treated as partners, not just attendees.

**From local experiment to replicable model**

The final Ambassador Playbook will capture:

1. Effective recruitment channels,
2. Training structures,
3. Messaging that worked (and what failed),
4. Realistic impact measurements.

This can be adapted to other Indonesian cities, other sectors (property, agriculture, logistics), and other countries that want to bring non-crypto communities into governance.

sub_fields.title: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.description: Please define the positive impact your project will have on the wider Cardano community
sub_fields.answer:
# Positive impact on the wider Cardano community


**Broadening the social base of governance**



Cardano gains new types of voters and reviewers: mechanics, small dealers, and used-car buyers people with strong instincts for fraud detection and risk management. Their presence can:

1. Improve how RWA, lending, and mobility-focused proposals are evaluated,
2. Diversify the lived experiences represented in governance,
3. Increase perceived legitimacy of decisions for non-crypto observers.



**Strengthening Cardano’s trust narrative in emerging markets**



Indonesia is a strategic Web3 market with a booming used-car sector. A documented example of used-car communities engaging with Cardano governance:

1. Shows Cardano is operating where trust failures are real,
2. Supports RWA and DePIN narratives with human stories,
3. Attracts interest from regulators, media, and potential partners who want more than speculation.



**Providing reusable tools for other community builders**



All ambassador materials (EN/ID) will be published openly, allowing other teams to:

1. Reuse governance explainers and onboarding flows,
2. Avoid reinventing basic content for every new initiative,
3. Build on a shared, tested vocabulary around ambassadors and micro-events.



**Supporting the evolution of CAR\-dano and related RWA projects**



As CAR-dano and similar efforts grow, they need:

1. Users who understand why on-chain inspection data matters,
2. Communities prepared to critique and improve systems,
3. Advocates who can explain both the benefits and the limits of on-chain trust.



This project lays that human groundwork, tightly aligned with Catalyst’s community and governance objectives.

sub_fields.title: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.description: What is your capability to deliver your project with high levels of trust and accountability? How do you intend to validate if your approach is feasible?
sub_fields.answer:
# Why this team can deliver


**Operational base: PT Inspeksi Mobil Jogja / CAR\-dano v1**



PT Inspeksi Mobil Jogja (PALAPA) is an active used-car inspection company that:

1. Handles hundreds of inspections per month across multiple Indonesian cities,
2. Applies standardized inspection processes (200+ checkpoints, detailed multi-page reports),
3. Maintains strong relationships with buyers, sellers, dealers, and workshops.



The team has already:

1. Delivered CAR-dano v1 in Fund13 (on-chain inspection reports as NFTs / immutable records),
2. Experienced the friction between real operations, inspectors, and blockchain artifacts,
3. Clear incentives: better trust infrastructure directly improves their service quality and customer outcomes.



# **Community and education experience**


The proposer has:

1. A mechanical engineering background,
2. Experience working with universities and local communities in Indonesia,
3. Active involvement in Cardano RWA and governance discussions.



PALAPA already runs:

1. Educational content on car condition and inspections,
2. Social media channels explaining vehicle issues to non-technical audiences,
3. Collaborations with automotive communities across Central Java.



# Feasibility of scope


A 6-month timeframe is sufficient to:

1. Design the ambassador program,
2. Recruit and train at least 25 ambassadors,
3. Run multiple waves of micro-events,
4. Consolidate the experience into a playbook and final report.

With 18,000 ADA, the focus is on field activities and documentation rather than heavy infrastructure.



# Validation of approach


We will validate feasibility through:

1. Documented recruitment and attendance lists,
2. Logs of ambassador-led sessions and participant counts,
3. Aggregated figures on governance-capable wallets (privacy-respecting),
4. A credible Ambassador Playbook that reflects real experiments, not theory.

sub_fields.title: Project Milestones
sub_fields.description: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?

sub_fields.title: What are the key milestones you need to achieve in order to complete your project successfully?
sub_fields.description: The number of milestones required depends on the amount of funding requested. Please refer to the Guidance card on the right for details

sub_fields.title: Milestone Title
sub_fields.description: A clear, concise title for this milestone
sub_fields.answer: Program Design & Partner Mapping

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
A comprehensive program blueprint is created during this phase. This includes a full definition of the Ambassador role, covering responsibilities, boundaries, expectations, reporting cadence, event formats they may host, and a clearly written code of conduct tailored for automotive communities. 



Version 1 of the Ambassador Handbook is produced, containing foundational governance explanations, simple scripts for explaining Cardano in local language, and practical instructions for micro-events.



A structured training curriculum is drafted, detailing 3–4 core training sessions. Each session will include learning objectives, rough agendas, audience considerations, and required materials.



Parallel to this, a partner-mapping exercise is conducted across Surakarta and Yogyakarta to identify the most relevant communities. The mapping covers:

- major car clubs (model-specific, regional),
- active workshops and mechanics with strong community influence,
- small dealership groups and local gathering spots.

A recruitment plan is produced including digital posters, WhatsApp message templates, intro scripts, and short invitation blurbs designed for easy circulation in automotive groups.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
- Ambassador Handbook (v1) published publicly in both English and Bahasa Indonesia.
- Training curriculum fully documented, including session goals, flow, and material list.
- A verified list of minimum 30 ambassador candidates, categorized by type (dealer, workshop, car club, customer).
- All planning documents accessible via a shared public folder.

- Screenshots, PDFs, or Figma links showing design drafts and messaging templates.

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
Ambassador recruitment is executed and finalized, resulting in at least 25 confirmed ambassadors representing diverse automotive stakeholder groups. The team conducts three structured training sessions, either in-person or hybrid:

1. _Cardano & Trust in Used\-Car Markets_ – grounding blockchain concepts in real automotive problems.
2. _Project Catalyst & Governance Basics _– explaining proposals, voting, DReps, treasury, and real decision flows.
3. _Practical Wallet & Voter Registration_ – hands-on onboarding to governance-capable wallets.



Supporting educational content is produced:

- ≥2 polished slide decks in Bahasa Indonesia (with optional EN),
- 2–3 one-page handouts (wallet setup, governance basics, common Q&A),
- 2–3 short videos or audio clips ambassadors can forward inside their groups.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
1.  Attendance logs confirming ≥25 ambassadors trained across sessions.
2. Pre/post survey results demonstrating measurable improvement in understanding governance and Cardano fundamentals.
3. All session materials uploaded to a public repository with sensitive content removed.

sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
1. Photos, screenshots, and attendance records.
2. Links to decks, handouts, and short media clips.
3. Training summary report outlining participant engagement and next-step recommendations.

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
Ambassadors begin field activities through **≥20 micro\-events**, ranging from workshop gatherings to small club meetups and online sessions. These events introduce Cardano governance in everyday language while demonstrating wallet setup and voting flows.



The cumulative outreach targets **≥150 community participants** across all events. The program focuses on **hands\-on voter onboarding**, supporting participants through wallet setup, security practices, and governance registration.



Simultaneously, the core team provides **continuous coordination**, including monthly check-ins, group channels for troubleshooting, iterative refinement of ambassador scripts, and real-time adjustments to training materials.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
1. A complete and timestamped log of all micro-events, including attendance estimates, event type, photos, and ambassador notes.
2. Evidence that ≥150 individuals were reached.
3. At least 100 governance-capable wallets successfully registered for a Catalyst voting round, validated using anonymized counts or privacy-respecting screenshots.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
1. Full event log, photos, attendance sheets, and screenshots.
2. Aggregated participation statistics with simple charts/graphs.
3. Testimonials or short stories from ambassadors demonstrating qualitative impact.

sub_fields.answer: Playbook, Sharing & Close-Out

sub_fields.title: Milestone Outputs
sub_fields.description: What will be delivered in this milestone
sub_fields.answer:
The program culminates in a bilingual Community Ambassador Playbook – Used-Car Edition (English + Indonesian). The playbook includes detailed sections on:

- recruitment strategies and messaging,
- training modules and session templates,
- micro-event models and scripts,
- governance onboarding flows,
- common obstacles and best practices,
- lessons learned and recommendations for replication.

The team conducts 1–2 public sharing sessions, presenting the full experience to Cardano Indonesia and Catalyst communities.

A complete final report is produced with:

- all metrics and outcomes,
- engagement analysis,
- financial summary,
- recommendations for future vertical-specific ambassador hubs.

sub_fields.title: Acceptance Criteria
sub_fields.description: Specific conditions that must be met
sub_fields.answer:
1. Playbook published openly (PDF + public folder).
2. At least one public presentation delivered, with recording or written minutes.
3. Final close-out report and video submitted per Catalyst SoM guidelines.

sub_fields.title: Evidence of Completion
sub_fields.description: How you will demonstrate achievement
sub_fields.answer:
1. Links to playbook and public repository.
2. Links to recordings or written summaries of sharing sessions.
3. Links to final report and close-out video.

2. Validate testnet minting flows
3. Provide minimal tech oversight when needed

sub_fields.title: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.description: Please provide a cost breakdown of the proposed work and resources
sub_fields.answer:
**Total requested:** 18,000 ADA

**Duration:** 6 months



**Approximate breakdown:**



**Program design & materials – 4,000 ADA**

- Designing ambassador roles and handbook.
- Developing training curriculum and scripts.
- Initial partner outreach and planning.

**Training delivery & content production – 5,000 ADA**

- Venue, logistics, and refreshments for core training.
- Local travel within Central Java.
- Design and production of printed and digital materials, short media clips.

**Ambassador activation & micro\-event support – 6,000 ADA**

- Modest stipends or cost support for ambassadors (transport, snacks, basic venue costs).
- Time from the core team for coordination and technical assistance.
- Tools/subscriptions for communication and impact tracking.

**Playbook production & ecosystem sharing – 3,000 ADA**

- Writing, editing, translation (EN/ID) of the playbook.
- Preparation and hosting of public sharing sessions.
- Design and formatting for ease of reuse.



We intentionally avoid:

1. Large fixed salaries disconnected from clear deliverables,
2. Expensive platform/app development,
3. Complex token economics or speculative incentives.



Most funds go directly into **community engagement, governance onboarding, and open documentation\.**

sub_fields.title: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.description: How does the cost of the project represent value for the Cardano ecosystem?
sub_fields.answer:
**For 18,000 ADA, the Cardano ecosystem gains:**

- A tested, documented Community Ambassador model rooted in a real, high-friction sector (used cars), not just abstract Web3 narratives.
- A trained cohort of ≥ 25 ambassadors and ≥ 100 newly onboarded governance-capable wallets in a key emerging market.
- An open, bilingual Ambassador Playbook and content pack that other teams can adapt immediately.
- A stronger integration between Cardano governance and an existing RWA-style operation (CAR-dano / PT Inspeksi Mobil Jogja).



Compared with the cost of large marketing campaigns or hackathons with diffuse outcomes, this is a focused, lean investment aimed at building **long\-term governance capacity** where it matters.



If successful, this project can:

- Serve as a reference pattern for vertical-specific ambassador hubs (mobility, property, agriculture, etc.),
- Provide a human layer that future RWA and DePIN proposals can plug into,
- Signal to DReps and voters that community & governance funds can directly connect Cardano to everyday trust problems in emerging markets.
